description.compact: Class to access a campaigns resources from the create send API.

docblock.description: This class includes functions to create and send campaigns, along with accessing lists of campaign specific resources i.e reporting statistics

description.compact: The base route of the campaigns resource.

param.description: The campaign id to access (Ignored for create requests)
Authentication details to use for API calls.

docblock.param:
This array must take one of the following forms: If using OAuth to authenticate: array( 'access_token' => 'your access token', 'refresh_token' => 'your refresh token')
Or if using an API key: array('api_key' => 'your api key')

param.description: The protocol to use for requests (http|https)
The level of debugging required CS_REST_LOG_NONE | CS_REST_LOG_ERROR | CS_REST_LOG_WARNING | CS_REST_LOG_VERBOSE
The host to send API requests to. There is no need to change this
The logger to use. Used for dependency injection
serialiser to use. Used for dependency injection
transport to use. Used for dependency injection

description.compact: Change the campaign id used for calls after construction
Creates a new campaign based on the provided campaign info.

docblock.description: At least on of the ListIDs and Segments parameters must be provided

param.description: The client to create the campaign for
The campaign information to use during creation.

docblock.param: This array should be of the form array( 'Subject' => string required The campaign subject 'Name' => string required The campaign name 'FromName' => string required The From name for the campaign 'FromEmail' => string required The From address for the campaign 'ReplyTo' => string required The Reply-To address for the campaign 'HtmlUrl' => string required A url to download the campaign HTML from 'TextUrl' => string optional A url to download the campaign text version from. If not provided, text content will be automatically generated from HTML content. 'ListIDs' => array<string> optional An array of list ids to send the campaign to 'SegmentIDs' => array<string> optional An array of segment ids to send the campaign to. )

return.description: A successful response will be the ID of the newly created campaign

description.compact: Creates a new campaign from a template based on the info provided.

docblock.description: At least on of the ListIDs and Segments parameters must be provided

param.description: The client to create the campaign for
The campaign information to use during creation.

docblock.param: This array should be of the form array( 'Subject' => string required The campaign subject 'Name' => string required The campaign name 'FromName' => string required The From name for the campaign 'FromEmail' => string required The From address for the campaign 'ReplyTo' => string required The Reply-To address for the campaign 'ListIDs' => array<string> optional An array of list ids to send the campaign to 'SegmentIDs' => array<string> optional An array of segment ids to send the campaign to 'TemplateID' => string required The ID of the template to use 'TemplateContent' => array required The content which will be used to fill the editable areas of the template )

return.description: A successful response will be the ID of the newly created campaign

description.compact: Sends a preview of an existing campaign to the specified recipients.

param.description: The recipients to send the preview to.
How to personalize the campaign content. Valid options are:

docblock.param: 'Random': Choose a random campaign recipient and use their personalisation data 'Fallback': Use the fallback terms specified in the campaign content

return.description: A successful response will be empty

description.compact: Sends an existing campaign based on the scheduling information provided

param.description: The campaign scheduling information.

docblock.param: This array should be of the form array ( 'ConfirmationEmail' => string required The email address to send a confirmation email to, 'SendDate' => string required The date to send the campaign or 'immediately'. The date should be in the format 'y-M-d' )

return.description: A successful response will be empty

description.compact: Unschedules the campaign, moving it back into the drafts. If the campaign has been sent or is in the process of sending, this api request will fail.

return.description: A successful response will be empty

description.compact: Deletes an existing campaign from the system

return.description: A successful response will be empty

description.compact: Gets all email addresses on the current clients suppression list

param.description: The page number to get
The number of records per page
The field to order the record set by ('EMAIL', 'LIST')
The direction to order the record set ('ASC', 'DESC')

return.description: A successful response will be an object of the form

description.compact: Gets all bounces recorded for a campaign

param.description: The date to start getting bounces from
The page number to get
The number of records per page
The field to order the record set by ('EMAIL', 'LIST', 'DATE')
The direction to order the record set ('ASC', 'DESC')

return.description: A successful response will be an object of the form

description.compact: Gets the lists a campaign was sent to

return.description: A successful response will be an object of the form

description.compact: Gets a summary of all campaign reporting statistics

return.description: A successful response will be an object of the form

docblock.return: { 'Recipients' => The total recipients of the campaign 'TotalOpened' => The total number of opens recorded 'Clicks' => The total number of recorded clicks 'Unsubscribed' => The number of recipients who unsubscribed 'Bounced' => The number of recipients who bounced 'UniqueOpened' => The number of recipients who opened 'WebVersionURL' => The url of the web version of the campaign 'WebVersionTextURL' => The url of the web version of the text version of the campaign 'WorldviewURL' => The public Worldview URL for the campaign 'Forwards' => The number of times the campaign has been forwarded to a friend 'Likes' => The number of times the campaign has been 'liked' on Facebook 'Mentions' => The number of times the campaign has been tweeted about 'SpamComplaints' => The number of recipients who marked the campaign as spam }

description.compact: Gets the email clients that subscribers used to open the campaign

return.description: A successful response will be an object of the form

description.compact: Gets all opens recorded for a campaign since the provided date

param.description: The date to start getting opens from
The page number to get
The number of records per page
The field to order the record set by ('EMAIL', 'LIST', 'DATE')
The direction to order the record set ('ASC', 'DESC')

return.description: A successful response will be an object of the form

docblock.return: { 'ResultsOrderedBy' => The field the results are ordered by 'OrderDirection' => The order direction 'PageNumber' => The page number for the result set 'PageSize' => The page size used 'RecordsOnThisPage' => The number of records returned 'TotalNumberOfRecords' => The total number of records available 'NumberOfPages' => The total number of pages for this collection 'Results' => array( { 'EmailAddress' => The email address of the subscriber who opened 'ListID' => The list id of the list containing the subscriber 'Date' => The date of the open 'IPAddress' => The ip address where the open originated 'Latitude' => The geocoded latitude from the IP address 'Longitude' => The geocoded longitude from the IP address 'City' => The geocoded city from the IP address 'Region' => The geocoded region from the IP address 'CountryCode' => The geocoded two letter country code from the IP address 'CountryName' => The geocoded full country name from the IP address } ) }

description.compact: Gets all clicks recorded for a campaign since the provided date

param.description: The date to start getting clicks from
The page number to get
The number of records per page
The field to order the record set by ('EMAIL', 'LIST', 'DATE')
The direction to order the record set ('ASC', 'DESC')

return.description: A successful response will be an object of the form

docblock.return: { 'ResultsOrderedBy' => The field the results are ordered by 'OrderDirection' => The order direction 'PageNumber' => The page number for the result set 'PageSize' => The page size used 'RecordsOnThisPage' => The number of records returned 'TotalNumberOfRecords' => The total number of records available 'NumberOfPages' => The total number of pages for this collection 'Results' => array( { 'EmailAddress' => The email address of the subscriber who clicked 'ListID' => The list id of the list containing the subscriber 'Date' => The date of the click 'IPAddress' => The ip address where the click originated 'URL' => The url that the subscriber clicked on 'Latitude' => The geocoded latitude from the IP address 'Longitude' => The geocoded longitude from the IP address 'City' => The geocoded city from the IP address 'Region' => The geocoded region from the IP address 'CountryCode' => The geocoded two letter country code from the IP address 'CountryName' => The geocoded full country name from the IP address } ) }

description.compact: Gets all unsubscribes recorded for a campaign since the provided date

param.description: The date to start getting unsubscribes from
The page number to get
The number of records per page
The field to order the record set by ('EMAIL', 'LIST', 'DATE')
The direction to order the record set ('ASC', 'DESC')

return.description: A successful response will be an object of the form

docblock.return: { 'ResultsOrderedBy' => The field the results are ordered by 'OrderDirection' => The order direction 'PageNumber' => The page number for the result set 'PageSize' => The page size used 'RecordsOnThisPage' => The number of records returned 'TotalNumberOfRecords' => The total number of records available 'NumberOfPages' => The total number of pages for this collection 'Results' => array( { 'EmailAddress' => The email address of the subscriber who unsubscribed 'ListID' => The list id of the list containing the subscriber 'Date' => The date of the unsubscribe 'IPAddress' => The ip address where the unsubscribe originated } ) }

description.compact: Gets all spam complaints recorded for a campaign since the provided date

param.description: The date to start getting spam complaints from
The page number to get
The number of records per page
The field to order the record set by ('EMAIL', 'LIST', 'DATE')
The direction to order the record set ('ASC', 'DESC')

return.description: A successful response will be an object of the form

description.compact: The protocol to use while accessing the api
The base route of the create send api.
The serialiser to use for serialisation and deserialisation of API request and response data
The transport to use to send API requests

var.description: or CS_REST_SocketTransport or your own custom transport.

description.compact: The logger to use for debugging of all API requests
The default options to use for each API request.

docblock.description:
These can be overridden by passing in an array as the call_options argument to a single api request. Valid options are:
deserialise boolean: Set this to false if you want to get the raw response. This can be useful if your passing json directly to javascript.
While there are clearly other options there is no need to change them.

param.description: Authentication details to use for API calls.

docblock.param:
This array must take one of the following forms: If using OAuth to authenticate: array( 'access_token' => 'your access token', 'refresh_token' => 'your refresh token')
Or if using an API key: array('api_key' => 'your api key')
Note that this method will continue to work in the deprecated case when $auth_details is passed in as a string containing an API key.

param.description: The protocol to use for requests (http|https)
The level of debugging required CS_REST_LOG_NONE | CS_REST_LOG_ERROR | CS_REST_LOG_WARNING | CS_REST_LOG_VERBOSE
The host to send API requests to. There is no need to change this
The logger to use. Used for dependency injection
serialiser to use. Used for dependency injection
transport to use. Used for dependency injection

comment.value: If $auth_details is a string, assume it is an API key

description.compact: Refresh the current OAuth token using the current refresh token.

return.description: True if the wrapper is using SSL.

description.compact: Internal method to make a general API request based on the provided options
